Acquisition: Life Cycle Cost
   
  Decision Influence on Lifecycle Costs  
 
 

Logistics has a tremendous impact on the total cost of a weapon system. The chart below shows that about 70% of the decisions defining total life cycle costs are made very early in the acquisition process, when the concept is selected for development. Almost 95% of life cycle cost decisions are made before full scale production begins.

  

Obviously, logistics planning should start at the very beginning of the acquisition process. This allows the logistics elements to influence design. It is very difficult and costly to build in or add reliability, maintainability, testability, etc. after the system has been designed.
